elements.title: flag of Sark
elements.contents: ... that the flag of Sark (pictured) represented the last feudal state in the Western world, and is flown over the British Ministry of Justice every 6 August to commemorate the granting of the fief?

elements.title: Muhammad Ali Mungeri
elements.contents: ... that Muhammad Ali Mungeri was the prime founder of Darul Uloom Nadwatul Ulama, a major Islamic seminary in India?

elements.title: The Lone Furrow
elements.contents: ... that the neofolk album The Lone Furrow features several guest vocalists from heavy metal bands, and critics thought it might appeal to fans of that genre?

elements.title: a book detailing the short life of Indian actress Meena Kumari
elements.contents: ... that a book detailing the short life of Indian actress Meena Kumari was published just seven months after her death in 1972?

elements.title: Isabelle Connor
elements.contents: ... that rhythmic gymnast Isabelle Connor is the first UC Santa Cruz student to compete at the Olympics?

elements.title: Karaburun
elements.contents: ... that the Black Sea seaside resort of Karaburun features a lighthouse built in 1860 with decorative lion heads around its original copper dome?

elements.title: Jim Thorpe Trophy
elements.contents: ... that a cartoonist founded the Jim Thorpe Trophy that was awarded annually to the most valuable player of the National Football League?

elements.title: William Gott
elements.contents: ... that Leeds industrialist William Gott was charged with nuisance when his factory's steam engine produced "noisome and unwholesome smokes and vapours"?
